ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend HSHM 710 as a strong foundation and preparation for future work in the history and philosophy of science - for thinking about what theoretical tools to bring to one's analysis of sources, in particular.
An essential methods class, I would highly recommend it.

HSHM 710 is a methdological survey course designed to acquait students with the major trends and themes in contemporary HSHM. It provides a useful refresher for students with an HSHM background, and is an excellent resource for those who come from other disciplines. I would highly recommend HSHM 710 to other students owing to the diversity of the readings and the professional applicability of the material.
The students found the course rewarding, but would have preferred it, if they had taken the Problems in the History of Science first.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course helped me think about different ways to approach my topic, and in particular how to apply the philosophies and theories in the course readings in new ways to fit the geographical territories and intellectual traditions that characterize my research.

HSHM 710 familiarized me with the main trends in contemporary HSHM and provided valuable tools to analyze my own stance vis-a-vis the current historiography. I believe that I will utilize many of the methods and topics we addressed in class in my own dissertation and independent research. A highly valuable class.
It has made me more acutely aware of the major trends and methodologies in the field.
